intro: Phacelia douglasii var. petrophila, commonly known as the desert phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. This species is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its use in restoration projects.
